etymology.description: 电影 (film; movie) + 明星 (bright star; celebrity) = movie star.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the medium of film with the metaphor of a shining star to denote a celebrated performer in movies. Emphasizes fame that stands out within the film industry.
etymology.simplification: Only 電 → 电 was simplified in PRC reforms to reduce strokes by compressing the complex ‘electric’ component; 影、明、星 remained the same.

examples.chinese: 他是一位著名的电影明星(他是一位著名的電影明星)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yí wèi zhùmíng de diànyǐng míngxīng.
examples.english: He is a famous movie star.

examples.chinese: 这部新片让她一夜成名，成为当红的电影明星(這部新片讓她一夜成名，成為當紅的電影明星)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bù xīnpiàn ràng tā yíyè chéngmíng, chéngwéi dānghóng de diànyǐng míngxīng.
examples.english: This new film made her an overnight success, turning her into a top movie star.

examples.chinese: 许多电影明星积极参与公益活动(許多電影明星積極參與公益活動)。
examples.pinyin: Xǔduō diànyǐng míngxīng jījí cānyù gōngyì huódòng.
examples.english: Many movie stars actively take part in charity work.
